definitions.definition: ( music ) A pulse on the beat level , the metric level at which pulses are heard as the basic unit. Thus a beat is the basic time unit of a piece.

examples: I love watching her dance to a pretty drum beat with a bouncy rhythm!

subdefinitions.definition: ( music ) The rhythm signalled by a conductor or other musician to the members of a group of musicians.

definitions.definition: The instrumental portion of a piece of hip-hop music.
The interference between two tones of almost equal frequency
( authorship ) A short pause in a play , screenplay , or teleplay , for dramatic or comedic effect.
( by extension ) An area of a person's responsibility, especially

subdefinitions.definition: The route patrolled by a police officer or a guard.
( journalism ) The primary focus of a reporter's stories (such as police/courts, education, city government, business etc.).

definitions.definition: ( dated ) An act of reporting news or scientific results before a rival; a scoop .
( colloquial , dated ) That which beats, or surpasses, another or others.
( dated or obsolete , Southern US ) A precinct .
( dated ) A place of habitual or frequent resort.

subdefinitions.definition: ( Australia ) An area frequented by gay men in search of sexual activity. See gay beat .

definitions.definition: ( archaic ) A low cheat or swindler .
( hunting ) The act of scouring, or ranging over, a tract of land to rouse or drive out game ; also, those so engaged, collectively.
( fencing ) A smart tap on the adversary 's blade .
( slang ) A makeup look; compare beat one's face .
